Articles.Content:
<figure><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/87dda5f22121633ebc5ff4dc817129a6/tumblr_inline_njlwfe1Jy41rr2wit.jpg"/></figure><p>It took Avera9eJoe three months, two saves and a new computer to finish his impressive mission to Duna and back. Now he’s released a compilation video of Project Inquiry, check it out below and don’t forget to visit and follow his Youtube channel!</p>

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kX7eds4Th14" frameborder="0"></iframe>

<a href="https://www.youtube.com/user/theavera9ejoe/featured" target="_blank">CLICK HERE</a> to visit Avera9eJoe’s Youtube channel!
First! Nice job mate, I should try something like that or...wait. Anyone heard of KSPTOMARS?
Joe, you earned it. That mission was brilliant.
Beautiful music, good craft, and good video. Keep it up Avera9eJoe!
I love the way the nuke exhaust glows red with HotRockets. The engine boost away at the end looked awesome!

You should start using the ambient light mod. Watching a video where 7 out of 15 mins are black with rcs jets fireing is kindah a waste of time. If we could have seen what was going on it would have been good. With this much blackness it's kindah annoying.

Nice one Joe! Are you perchance, a Larry Niven fan?

EDIT: I finally got to see your boat circumnavigation. Did you finish? Did the calcs work out?

Edited February 14, 2015 by FleshJeb

Nice one Joe! Are you perchance, a Larry Niven fan?

EDIT: I finally got to see your boat circumnavigation. Did you finish? Did the calcs work out?

Ah! I know of Larry Niven, but I sadly have no read anything of his . As to the boat circumnavigation, no I haven't finished and when the the new SP+ parts replaced the legacy wings, I stopped. I could definitely pull that back up again though. Building a new hydrofoil boat wouldn't be hard.

What did you use to record that video? it looks like you were capturing a frame a second.

Thanks
Great job. This video gives great feelings... Well done.
Again thank you all so much for the appreciation. Making Video Wednesdays is the KSP YouTubers dream and thank you all so much for the recognition.

Wohoo! Great job man!

Well deserved too, I watched that mission when you released it. Great fun and genuinely tense at times.
Congrats on this awesome Mission to Duna dude!
